title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
desc: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
desc: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
desc: A memoir of a life filled with meaning and accomplishment.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
desc: A powerful memoir about a young girl's journey to education and self-discovery.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
desc: A guide to personal and professional effectiveness.

title: Man's Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
desc: A psychiatrist's account of his experiences in Nazi concentration camps.

title: Thinking, Fast and Slow
author: Daniel Kahneman
desc: A book about the mind and the two systems that drive the way we think.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
desc: A guide to spiritual enlightenment.

title: Daring Greatly
author: Brené Brown
desc: A book about the power of vulnerability.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
desc: A brief history of humankind.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
desc: A novel about a young Andalusian shepherd and his journey to find his personal legend.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
author: Dale Carnegie
desc: A self-help book about improving social skills.

title: The Power of Habit
author: Charles Duhigg
desc: A book about the science of habit formation.

title: You Are a Badass
author: Jen Sincero
desc: A self-help book about personal growth and self-discovery.

title: Mindset
author: Carol S. Dweck
desc: A book about the psychology of success.

title: Neuromancer
author: William Gibson
desc: Case was the sharpest data-thief in the matrix—until he crossed the wrong people and they crippled his nervous system, banishing him from cyberspace.

title: Ender's Game
author: Orson Scott Card
desc: In order to develop a secure defense against a hostile alien race's next attack, government agencies breed child geniuses and train them as soldiers.

title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
desc: Seconds before the Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy.

title: Snow Crash
author: Neal Stephenson
desc: Only Hiro Protagonist can save the future, and he's got the brain and the high-tech weaponry to do it.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
desc: A mission to Mars goes wrong, and astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead and left behind. But Watney is still alive.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
desc: In a dystopian future, the totalitarian nation of Panem is divided into 12 districts and the Capitol. Each year two young representatives from each district are selected by lottery to participate in The Hunger Games.

title: The Forever War
author: Joe Haldeman
desc: Private William Mandella is a reluctant hero in an interstellar war against an unknowable and unconquerable alien enemy.

title: The Dispossessed
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
desc: The story of two planets, Anarres and Urras, which are twin planets orbiting a distant star. Urras is a lush, capitalist planet while Anarres is a barren, anarchistic planet.

title: Do Androids Dream of Electric Sheep?
author: Philip K. Dick
desc: In a post-apocalyptic future, bounty hunter Rick Deckard is tasked with terminating androids that look and act like humans.

title: The Left Hand of Darkness
author: Ursula K. Le Guin
desc: A human envoy is sent to the planet of Gethen, inhabited by a sexually ambivalent race, in order to persuade them to join an interplanetary alliance.
